trans-unit.source: Defines the abstract methods required to implement a plug-in document serialization <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> collator.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, initiates the start of a batch write operation.
When overridden in a derived class, cancels a synchronous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.Write*"></xref> operation.
When overridden in a derived class, cancels an asynchronous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync*"></xref> operation.
When overridden in a derived class, completes a batch write operation.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.Write%2A> method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
The visual element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element together with an associated print ticket to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.Write%2A> method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written to the stream.
An object specifying preferences for how the material should be printed.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> methods write to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
The visual element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element with a specified event identifier to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> methods write to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.

`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.
The visual element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element together with an associated print ticket to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
The visual element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the visual element.

When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element together with an associated print ticket and identifier to the serialization stream.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.

`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.
The visual element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the visual element.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.
